questions.question: What makes dynamic workflows dynamic?
options: They dynamically scale their the number of FME Server engines being used to account for the volume of data being processed.
They dynamically reproject data to the user's chosen coordinate system.
They dynamically speed up and slow down data processing to save energy.
They dynamically define or construct the schema at run-time, not beforehand.

questions.question: Which of the following scenarios would be appropriate for using a dynamic workflow?
options: You need to build a workspace that converts any spatial data inputs, regardless of attributes, to GML.
You need to build a workspace that loads as-built CAD drawings with a predictable schema into a GIS database.
You need to build a workspace that takes data with a set schema but no set format and writes it out to the user's choice of format.
You need to build a workspace that uploads monthly expense reports in Excel format to a database. The schema doesn't change month-to-month.

questions.question: A dynamic workspace will always read/write any format of data.
